definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

(main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture
the Great Hall of the People in Beijing

sentences.english: Opening ceremony of the 2011 Summer Camp at the Guangxi - Great Hall of the People.
sentences.chinese: 在南宁市的广西人民大会堂举行开营仪式。

sentences.english: However, in my dream, Jabes had a full and attentive congregation ;
sentences.chinese: 但是，在我的梦里，杰别斯有专心听讲的满会堂会众。

sentences.english: 21They went to Capernaum, and when the Sabbath came, Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.
sentences.chinese: 到了迦百家，耶稣就在安息日进了会堂教训人。

sentences.english: For Truth Stumbles In The Public Square, And Righteousness Cannot Enter.
sentences.chinese: 在公众大会堂中真理绊跌，且公义不得其门而入。

sentences.english: Outside, thousands of people formed up in long queues, waiting their turn to enter the hall.
sentences.chinese: 外面成千上万的人排长队等候进入大会堂。

sentences.english: The minister stands in the front of the auditoria.
sentences.chinese: 牧师站在会堂的最前面。

sentences.english: The trial had been scheduled to take place at a Cairo convention hall Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 该审判原定于星期三在开罗一个大会堂进行。

sentences.english: The assembly hall was overcrowded long before the performance began.
sentences.chinese: 演出开始前，大会堂里早已挤得水泄不通了。

sentences.english: I think the splendid building on the west side must be the Great Hall of the People.
sentences.chinese: 我想西边那座宏伟建筑一定是人民大会堂了。

sentences.english: It's a pity that we don't have a community hall at WCH to hold such activity.
sentences.chinese: 可惜，我们黄竹坑没有社区会堂可以举类似的活动。

sentences.english: 15He taught in their synagogues, and everyone praised him.
sentences.chinese: 他在各会堂里教训人，众人都称赞他。

sentences.english: A singer must learn to project his voice so as to be heard in a large hall.
sentences.chinese: 须学会把声音送得远，使会堂里的人都听得见。

sentences.english: The banquet was held in the brightly-lit Great Hall of the People.
sentences.chinese: 宴会在灯火辉煌的人民大会堂举行。

sentences.english: The Great Hall of the People is beflagged.
sentences.chinese: 人民大会堂上插满旗子。

sentences.english: 5When they arrived at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues.
sentences.chinese: 到了撒拉米，就在犹太人各会堂里传讲神的道。

sentences.english: A concert is to take place at the town hall tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天市公会堂要举行音乐会。

definition: to go to church on Sunday (of Christians)
tabernacle (biblical word for a meeting hall or tent)
